snippet: Baltimore residents prepared to resume the more familiar rhythms of their lives as days passed without new bouts of widespread rioting and as the National Guard began to pull its troops from the city.
abstract: National Guard starts to remove its troops from Baltimore after several days of calm following riots and demonstrations; Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake lifts curfew imposed after unrest over death of black man Freddie Gray, who died of injuries suffered while in policy custody.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER, RICHARD FAUSSET and NIKITA STEWART
byline.contributor: Stacy Cowley contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Baltimore residents prepared to resume the more familiar rhythms of their lives as days passed without new bouts of widespread rioting and as the National Guard began to pull its troops from the city.

headline.main: In Baltimore, National Guard Pullout Begins as Citywide Curfew Is Lifted
headline.print_headline: Two Gestures Begin to Ease a City’s Strife
